Access to records

All persons with parental
responsibility or care of a child
have a legal right of access to
This applies even if another person
This right can only be removed by
court order. But the law provides that
schools can refuse if they believe
that disclosure of the records would
be likely to cause serious harm to the
pupils physical or mental health or
such requests. It may be appropriate
for the school to consider when
child s current home address should be
If a school feels circumstances have
changed they must take steps to

A solicitors letter is not proof that
Schools should not act on this alone.
